body.p: Under US GAAP, the accounting treatment of share‑based payment transactions differs, depending on whether the other party to the transaction is an employee or non‑employee, and whether the entity chooses to apply SFAS 123 or APB 25 to transactions with employees. Having a choice of accounting methods is generally regarded as undesirable. Indeed, the Board recently devoted much time and effort to developing improvements to existing international standards, one of the objectives of which is to eliminate choices of accounting methods.
